New Records: Freddie Freeman’s walk-off grand slam secured the Dodgers victory over the Yankees in the 10th inning of the first game of the World Series.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman hit a walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. put the Yankees ahead in the top of the 10th inning by singling, stealing second and third, and scoring the go-ahead run.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a go-ahead, two-run home run in the sixth inning.
Shohei Ohtani doubled high off the center-field wall and scored on a sacrifice fly.
Tommy Edman made a diving stop to prevent a run in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Freddie Freeman’s ankle was feeling better, which could keep him in the Game 2 lineup against Yankees lefty Carlos Rodón.
The Dodgers will counter with their biggest offseason pitching addition, Yoshinobu Yamamoto, in Game 2.
Both Rodón and Yamamoto have pitched well in their past two postseason starts.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'Tonight, the game honored him,' referring to Freddie Freeman.
Mookie Betts expressed pride in Freeman, saying, 'I’m glad it’s him that did it.'
Aaron Judge emphasized the need to move forward, saying, 'It’s time to go to work.'
Blake Treinen reflected on the moment, saying, 'I mean that was the most incredible moment in baseball I’ve seen.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The team that has won Game 1 has gone on to win the World Series 24 of the last 30 times.
Freddie Freeman’s walk-off grand slam drew comparisons to Kirk Gibson’s iconic walk-off home run in Game 1 of the 1988 World Series.
Joe Davis paid homage to Vin Scully with his call of Freeman’s grand slam.
Others: Nestor Cortes was used as a lefty specialist and faced Shohei Ohtani and Freddie Freeman in the 10th inning.
Juan Soto’s error in the eighth inning allowed Shohei Ohtani to reach third base, leading to a tying run.
Gleyber Torres acknowledged that his eighth-inning double was not a homer after seeing the replay.
Alex Verdugo made an incredible play on a Shohei Ohtani fly ball in the 10th inning.
